reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: Had a 4 night stay at this hotel. Booked 2 rooms in November and requested them to be together as we had our daughter with us. When we went to check in the best they could do was on the same floor 5 rooms apart, great start! Rooms were a decent size, beds were comfortable,with crisp,clean sheets, flat screen tv and ample storage and draws.I know this is an Art Decor hotel but the decor needs to be attended to, marks on wall, grubby carpet, chipped furniture,mis-tiled bathroom,sticking windows.
reviews.title: good location but very noisy.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: About the noise. This has to be one of the noisiest hotels I have ever been in. We were 2 doors away from the lift and whenever it was used there was such a clatter from the doors even when it was on other floors you could still hear it. All the room doors to the corridor had springs on them so they were banging whenever anyone came in or went out,not very nice at 3.30 in the morning.
reviews.title: Awesome Experience Again!

likes.liked: — Service and size of our room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Even my daughter was troubled by this noise and she was 5 rooms away. The walls in this hotel are as thick as a newspaper so you can expect to hear the slightest sound from adjoining rooms. Hotel has 1 ice machine and yes youve guessed it, its on the 4th floor where we were so everyone in the hotel was coming for ice at all hours. Pool area is adequate but why use it when you have a good beach across the road. Used the bar in the hotel once seemed a bit pricey so found 2 irish bars on Washington ave. Complimentary breakfast is next door in the restaurant Casablanca, toast, coffee, bagel etc. Free internet in business room.
reviews.title: Had a great weekend at the Park Central!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel has a great location on Ocean Drive just across from the beach. Staff were ok, maid service good, doormen/baggage men helpfull but this hotel has got to address the noise problem. Be warned, take your ear plugs.
reviews.title: Great Location !!

likes.liked: — The Location and the art-deco feel
likes.disliked: — Our bathroom, but everything was in working order, just very dated.

reviews.title: Andicat loved this location
reviews.text: We stayed from June 8-13th and we were extremely happy with our experience. This was my fourth visit to South Beach and the second time I stayed at the Park Central. I stayed there about five years ago and I am so happy that we decided to stay again.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for 5 nights prior to taking a cruise. Loved the art deco ambiance in the neighborhood and hotel. We wanted to experience the art deco area & hotel and are so pleased we did so, Across the street is the beach & a park .Yes very small rooms, but very comfortable with updated bathrooms. We love the charm of historic hotels & small intimate, boutique hotels, so didn't opt for a large hotel brand. Ocean Blvd is lined with indoor/outdoor restaurants and music begins in late afternoon and continues until at least midnight. It was fantastic to walk from outdoor restaurant to restaurant listening to guitar, flamenco guitar & dancer, cuban jazz, latin sambas, etc. Couldn't get enought of it. In our rooms we noticed no noise. amazingly enough. The only restaurant that stood out was superb, Quinn's--located at our hotel. We didn't expect this. We absolutely loved Quinn's. Outstanding service.Not inexpenive. One evening we had Floridian lobster---delicious. These were "10"'s . But also they were $75 each. Went to some other restaurants such as Prime which was closing for the season in a few days. Not as good as Quinn's. The bartender @ Quinn's made some of the best drinks ever!!!! We also went to Little Havana and dined at Versailles--delicious cuban food!!!!
reviews.title: Great Experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The positives first - Great location on South Beach which is perfect for Ocean Drive and the wonderful beach, but that's about it.
reviews.title: Very average hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: The room was very shabby and tired looking. The hotel needs a good renovation if it wants to compete with the better hotels in the area. It was also very noisy in the middle of the night. The occupants of the adjoining room next door obviously were too arrogant to care or oblivious to their neighbours trying to sleep next door at 2am with music and shouting until the early hours. Staff looked very bored and lifeless.
reviews.title: Nightmare on OCEAN DRIVE!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Would not stay here again.
reviews.title: Great location but rooms are looking tired

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: The website is so misleading. The hotel looks NOTHING like the pictures. The front desk lost our reservation and gave me and my sister a one bed room, I had to share a bed with the most needy person in the world. She was farting all night long and the hotel couldn't accommodate us.I specifically asked for two beds because of her gas troubles.The room was so tiny the smell would travel round and round over my head. The room itself was dirty DIR-TY! Not to mentioned it was overpriced. The location however is great. The pool looks like a swamp. The front desk is falling apart, whoever reviews this hotel as beautiful must have never stayed anywhere better than a 6motel. Stay away from this place. eeew!
reviews.title: Very nice indeed !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: Park Central is special boutique hotel in the heart of South Beach. Location is ideal. The staff is friendly and helpful. .The room was clean and comfortable. A small bathroom but great water pressure , king bed with down comforter, a strong a/c plus fan, great view, ( they graciously gave us an upgrade). . chaise lounges at the beach w/ towels were included w/ room all added up to a perfect stay. Can't wait to book my next visit!!!
reviews.title: A great find

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I just returned from my stay at The Park Central Hotel and I must say that this is one of the best hotels I have stayed in. The location is perfect because it is located on Ocean Drive which is directly across the street from the beach. We were able to enjoy the nightlife without having to venture very from from the hotel. The staff is excellent- Jose who worked at the front desk was very helpful. The concierge recommended good choices for places to eat as well. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who is looking to have a good stay in South Beach!!!!
reviews.title: The One

likes.disliked: — The elevator was being serviced during checkout time

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: After 10 days in the Keys, we approached a three night stay on South Beach with some trepidation, expecting a much less tranquil experience. While the area is certainly lively, and in some locations I imagine it would be difficult to get much sleep, at the Park Central you have the best of both worlds. On the one hand it's very much part of the South Beach scene, being right on Deco Drive and a thoroughyl authentic Art Deco structure. On the other hand it's right at the southern end, so while everything is within easy reach, you're not right on top of a busy bar. In addition we had south facing rooms which added to the quiet. We did hear some of the more lively of the other guests but only occasionally.
reviews.title: Great Base for South Beach

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel just drips 30's ambience. Everything's clean and freshly decorated, so if some of the fabric of the building is showing its age, this just adds to the atmosphere rather than looking shabby.
reviews.title: Park Central was the Best

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a fashionable location and I've grown to expect a rather aloof attitude in such places, however here the staff were genuinely friendly and helpful (particularly Jose & Luis), which came as a pleasant surprise. There's free (if a bit slow) internet access, free loan of towels for the beach or pool and complementary loungers on the beach.
reviews.title: Don't Skip This Review

likes.liked: — Beautifully restored and maintained historic hotel with modern ammenities
likes.disliked: — There was only one ice machine

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I chose this hotel after reading numerous positive reviews on Trip Advisor. If we had to do the trip all over again, we would have chosen a different hotel, no question. The check-in was pretty standard. We got a room in the smaller tower, on the third floor. After we valeted our rental car ($25/day) and received our room keys, the valet helped bring our bags up to our room. Our room looked as expected, so no surprises there, but I noticed that the AC unit was very noisy, although it seemed bearable at first. It got noiser without cooling the room at all, and later, water started spurting out of the vents. Then, that evening, we noticed water falling from the bathroom door frame, which looked like a mini shower storm right in our room!!! We immediately notified the front desk, after which they moved us to a room in the taller tower on the second floor. This room was connected to the adjacent room by a suite door, and the walls were paper thin. We could hear every word from the people in the next room…all the loud music, party games, TV, drinking, etc. each night. It was horrible! Also, every ten minutes we would hear this loud BANG! We finally figured out that it was from all the other visitors on our hall coming in and out of their rooms, and each time, the door would bang shut as loud as ever. We also tried the restaurant next door called Casablanca’s after reading other reviews on this site. This place was THE WORST. The hostess tried seating us at a dirty table, the waitress was rude, the food was terrible, and to top it off, they added gratuity to a party of two!! I don’t know how this hotel, and that restaurant stay in business. Believe me, pick a different hotel while you still have time.
reviews.title: Awful Stay at Park Central

likes.disliked: — Water leaks, paper-thin walls, small room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Park Central Miami - Excellent Choice
reviews.title: Excellent Choice

likes.liked: — Location and atmosphere, a real step back in time to the fifties.
likes.disliked: — Quinns the hotel restaurant was too expensive

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.title: Absoulutely loved The Park Central

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We chose the Patk Central after reading the good reviews on Trip Advisor. It turned out to be an excellent choice for the start of our Florida holiday. Every one was very friendly and helpful. Particularly Louie on the front Desk and the Concierge team. The room was very clean, and as lots of people have said, the beds extremely comfortable. The public areas were also well looked after. We were prepared for the bathroom to be small from reading some of the reviiews but sorry our bathroom, although cannot be described as large, was not small. The "partial sea view" was the best view we have ever had from a hotel window. (See attached photo).
reviews.title: Nightmare Vacation stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Park Central is right in the thick of the Art Deco area, lots of good restaurants, bars, places to visit and nightlife. We had three great nights sleep with no disturbance from outside noise. The beach is just across the road outside the hotel. We never had a car but spent an enjoyable 3 days walking , browsing, people watching, etc before spending a week in the Keys.
reviews.title: The pefect choice!
Loved IT
reviews.text: The park central was a wonderful. Great location its best that u request a higher room to be away from the noise. We stayed in room 507 and didn't hear much from the street. Front desk and concierge were very pleasant and helpful. Rooms were beautiful made u feel like u were in an apartment.... Only negative is that very few outlets and walls are extremely thin. A couple next door kept waking us up with their noise.... No complaints otherwise would stay there again in a heartbeat

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: Stayed one night on overnight trip to SoBe, taking my visiting nieces (ages 18 and 15). Decided on Park Central based on reviews, location and recommendation of TA Local Expert. Very glad I did! For the money, the Park Central is great! Location is one of the best features, directly on Ocean Drive with Lummus Park and Beach across the street, and in the middle of South Beach and walking distance to most everywhere. Opted to valet my car ($25/day), but they offer a rate for self parking in garage around the corner at 7th and Collins for about $8/day. We arrived earlier than the 3 pm check in and were able to have them store our luggage until the room was ready; they also stored it for us the next day while we went to the beach (no charge for this service). Our room was decent (2 double beds); beds very comfortable, rooms smallish (but most in SoBe are), flat screen HDTV, minibar. They did look a little "worn", but it is a historic hotel. One great feature is the roof top terrace with comfortable chaise lounges for relaxing and sunbathing - our room was 605, right by the terrace. Although there is a Rumba bar next door, we found that the noise level was very low. We had partial ocean view, which was really a good view of the ocean and the small pool area. Found the front desk staff to be very helpful, friendly and attentive. Concierge very helpful, able to book tours, reservations, etc. Bellmen attentive and friendly. Did find that we had to wait almost an hour to have them pick up our luggage when checking out of room - however, this was at 12 noon and they had 30 people checking in, 30 checking out, according to the bellman who finally showed up.
reviews.title: Great location!

likes.liked: — The location and the rooftop terrace

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We really enjoyed our stay at the Park Central. The location is brilliant, right on South Beach.
reviews.title: Great location, beautiful hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled solo
reviews.text: We had a car with us and parking was easy to arrange through the hotel. The restaurant and lobby are beautiful and the roof terrace is really lovely. The swimming pool is TINY but you're only over the road from the beach so it doesn't really matter.
reviews.title: Bring your ear plugs!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We found the room quite small but really comfortable. Didn't notice any noise from the street or from other rooms/corridors but we did visit at a really quiet time of the year.
reviews.title: Great place on Ocean Drive
Great Service and Ambiance
reviews.text: Yes it's an old hotel - many period features mean things are old and are not new - but - great location in the Art Deco section - staff have been helpful and polite. food is good in the restaurant. Good value and it's on Ocean Drive South Beach - cant get much better. Highly recommended. Room 403 was quiet and very efficient aircon. Very clean.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is in the heart of South Beach action. Our first real impression was the dimly lit, somewhat dingy looking hallway but I understand that they are trying to keep with the golden years time period so that can be shrugged off. Our room was a nice surprise: comfortable bed, clean, fabulous TV and spacious. I think this place grew on us since we staid 5 nights here because our plans to go to Key West had to be cancelled due to the hurricane. I haven't staid in any of the other hotels along the Ocean Ave strip but Park Central seemed above all the others in this section. If you are looking for a fancy roof deck and pool, this hotel is not the right pick but they do have both.
reviews.title: Miami Beach, oh my!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I can't say thank you enough to the staff at The Park Central. During what could have been a stressful time, an impending hurricane, they showed so much consideration to us and between this and their lovely hotel and convenient location, we were able to make the best out of a rainy, windy situation.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel & staff during a tough situation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First, the hotel. We had a lovely corner room - worth the $50 upgrade. It was large, on the 6th floor and had a view of the beach and the entire strip, north and southbound. Though this is an old Art Deco hotel, the room was modern in terms of great linens and huge flat screen tv. The bathroom had its original lovely pink and black tile with loads of mirrors and original mirrored medicine cabinet. In this upgraded room, there was also a small window in the bathroom as well. We were very please with this room. I should mention that parking is $20 a day and is in a public lot about a block behind the hotel. Easy to access and we could come and go as we pleased, though we didn't need to car very much.
reviews.title: The Park Central Value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: What made this experience great was the hotel staff. From check in to check out, everyone went out of their way to lend a hand, smile and say hello. During the storm, our room windows and walls were leaking, leaving a wet mess on the carpets. They offered us another room and we declined, so they sent towels, a handyman and their apologizes. The morning that we went to check out, they were ready for us and the sweet manager apologized yet again and waived the upgrade fee entirely! What a nice unexpected surprise and it made this rainy trip a little less grim. I would stay at Park Central any time I'm in Miami. Its that good.
reviews.title: Girl in Miami

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled solo
reviews.text: Mid August trip recently made. This hotel is located in an excellent spot if you want to be near the beach for a great price. It is also located just across from some of the beach volleyball courts on south beach. The courts don't have lights but people play there intermittently mostly in the evening. The staff was helpful, they will hold your bag(s) if you get there early or still want to hang around after you check out. At night all the hotels along the road turn into outdoor restaurant and it is a very popular area.
reviews.title: Great Value for an excellent location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The small pool area with lounge chairs is a nice feature. Good spot to drop in after getting back from the beach.
reviews.title: Served Its Purpose

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms aren't the quietest, but its expected in an older hotel in that location. The fan in the outdoor hallway was kind of broken and noisy, but the in room A/C was able to drown it out okay.
reviews.title: Great Value, Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall I would definitely recommend it to friends. Decent Art Deco hotel in an excellent location on near the beach.
reviews.title: Great Weekend Getaway in South Beach

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This art deco is ideally located on Ocean Drive. The hotel has its charm, but some things could use a little attention. I'm aware it's a historic hotel, but a little putty and paint in the rooms could work wonders. Pros: Friendly staff, clean rooms, great location, free use of beach towels and use of chairs on beach directly in front of hotel (2 per room), free wifi. Cons: Rooms are a bit cramped (the ones with 2 beds at least), closet smelled of mildew, and room keys are on a dated system (we got locked out at 5am and had to wait 30 minutes before we could get back in due to problems with the system). It can be noisy, but that's expected in South Beach. Ladies - be aware that the only 2 mirrors are in the bathroom and the lighting isn't that great, so it can be hard to get ready to go out, but it’s feasible. Booked here in order to be close to friends staying at a nearby hotel that was sold out, and it was one of the few places that could guarantee a room with two beds. Got a great deal on Expedia (during a sale and no resort fee), but would not pay more than $150/night here. Oh, and the restaurant that has outdoor seating on Ocean Drive is quite expensive. I realize most of the Ocean Drive establishments are pricey, but this one was abnormally so. The bartender in the cafe though was very nice and accommodating.
reviews.title: perfect location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed here for a long "party" weekend. First off, the hotel's exterior is one of the best in SOBE and the staff is very friendly and go that extra step to make you feel special. The rooms are average size, but I suggest that if you stay, pay the extra $ for an ocean room view. Since there was some bad weather while we were there, it was nice to have a drink in our room and look out the window. We did luck out being on the 6th floor. The beds are very comfortable and shockingly, the hotel is very quiet.
reviews.title: Great Hotel and Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We never ate at the hotel, but seemed to always be hopping during dinner. One place I do recommend for breakfast is the Pelican Hotel. SOBE is a great getaway, and my wife and I will probably stay here every time. It is a short taxi ride to anywhere in SOBE and the fairs usually run under $10. This is not a hotel at the caliber of the Delano or Ritz, but for the price and location, YOU CANNOT BEAT IT!
reviews.title: Fantastic until the Hip Hop crowd turned up.

likes.disliked: — There's nothing to dislike about it

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at The Park Central for 4 nights from 21st May, we loved this hotel, the location is excellent and the staff are very helpful and friendly, our room was located on the 2nd floor and had a partial ocean view and was overlooking the small pool and garden, the room itself was lovely, although small we really liked the art deco bathroom and the bed was really comfortable too, we had the complimentry breakfast every morning at Casablancas which was lovely and dined at Casablancas once which was fantastic, the guy behind the bar (I think he's called Luis) really does make the best Mojitos in South Beach. Things started to change when the "Hip/Hop" crowd turned up, but this is of no fault of the hotel as the whole of South Beach was the same, the atmosphere and the vibe of the place just changed and we were glad to leave. But we will return to South Beach (just not on a holiday weekend) and we shall definitely stay at The Park Central again
reviews.title: Loved the Park Central

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Recently returned from a three night stay at the Park Central, having arrived on a Wednesday and returning on a Saturday night. My wife and I were excited to go away since this was our first extended vacation without the kids. We researched the hotel, particularly the prior reviews listed on this site. In general, we agreed with the prior reviews as the hotel is a perfect mid-size boutique hotel located in the heart of South Beach. Staff was extremely friendly and cooperative. Their beds were the best of any prior hotel we stayed at. Typically we go on vacation and look forward to sleeping in our own bed. Not this time. Upon our return home we laid in our bed and noticed an appreciable difference in comfort and quality. The Casablanca restaurant was excellent for breakfast and hotel. However, feel free to walk northbound on Ocean Drive and check the menus of the adjacent restaurants---look for dinner specials and happy hour specials. We especially enjoyed breakfast at Front Porch Cafe located at 14th Street and Ocean Drive, and had dinner at Emeril's located in the St. Moritz Hotel on 17th Street and Collins Avenue. Highly recommend the restaurant as the staff will make you feel special, Worth the splurge. Dinner for two was approximately $125.00. Also note that the room comes with two complimentary chairs on the beach representing a savings of $18.00 per day. Rooftop movie show was an excellent touch. Overall, you will not be disappointed.
reviews.title: Art Deco Heaven

likes.liked: — The Views, The Architecture, The Staff
likes.disliked: — Tad Expensive (but still worth splashing out)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had resigned ourselves to being stuck in a disappointing room with no view due to booking with a well-known online travel agent. We were in for a shock - the hotel had put us on the 6th floor overlooking Ocean Drive and South Beach!
reviews.title: Good Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: After reading all of the negative reviews about this hotel i decided to take a chance, and we have an awesome stay, overall, the location was perfect, price point you cant beat that, service excelente, from the bellman to the front desk, for those who complaint about the noise, this is ocean drive, what else can you espect, i did no hear any noise, the room was comfortable and the batroom is small but this hotel is an art deco and historic hotel from the 1930"s, we love it, and definetely comeback , pecial thanks to Nekeila, and jhon at the front desk, thanks to all of you keisha ,louis and evrybody, keep the good work
reviews.title: Great Hotel! Excelent Service!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Once again, after reading all of the negative reviews about this hotel, I started to second guess my decision to stay at The Park Central Hotel. However, I was glad we stayed here. I visted South Beach from July 12-15 and had an awesome time.
reviews.title: Had A Great Time in South Beach!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Okay, yes the hotel room are a bit dated, but overall I was very comfortable. Also, keep in mind the Park Central is a historic hotel. We were only in the room to sleep and shower, we spent the majority of the time partying on South Beach. If you want to be in the center of the action in South Beach, stay here. If you're planning on spending the majority of the time in your room, then you might want a more upscale hotel. The rooms are rather small, but we had a king bed that was very comfortable overall the room was clean other than being in need of a paint job.
reviews.title: Excellent location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The hotel staff was very nice and even though we arrived few hours before check in, our room was ready when we got there. The hotel staff was very helpful anytime we needed something. I would stay here again when visiting South Beach.
reviews.title: Resident at the moment

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Overall, the hotel is in a perfect location and the service was on point. I actually forgot some personal items while there so I called as soon as I got home to Jersey and the front desk personnel held them for me for 3 wks until I could pick them up! I was very grateful.
reviews.title: Great Location, Past its prime

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location for the Park Central is great, right in the middle of the action and just across the street from the beach. The hotel gives you complimentary towels and a beach chair which is a nice touch (an umbrella costs extra).
reviews.title: Great location and charm, bad service.

likes.liked: — Roof Deck and Location on the strip

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The roof deck is a relaxing oasis with a nice breeze and new age music playing, although the front desk didn't know what the music was or how to turn it back on when it stopped. The rooms are also in pretty good shape considering the age of the hotel, and the noise from our neighbors was minimal. The exercise facility and pool were also a pleasant surprise given the size of the hotel.
reviews.title: "Perfect" Park Central

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The only negative for this hotel is the customer service of its staff and the adjoining Casablanca restaurant. When we asked if we could check-in early instead of a friendly "not yet" we were treated rudely and ended up waiting until nearly 3:00. I understand if they were't able to get us in right away, but the attitude is not what I would expect at a boutique hotel.
reviews.title: No complaints!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall I would recommend this hotel as the amenities and quality were more than we expected for an older hotel. The primary area of improvement for this hotel is better customer service, and a focus on keeping things working (i.e. the stereo on the roof deck and the printer in the business lounge).
reviews.title: Disappointed from Sheffield ,Yorkshire.

likes.disliked: — lack of calm atmosphere in hotell

reviews.title: Never Again
reviews.text: My sister and I stayed here for a week this May and loved it! The hotel has a great location in the Art Deco area of South Beach and has not one but two vintage cars parked outside!! Our room was wonderful and bright, very clean and plenty big enough for a week's stay. The bathroom was small but sufficient and by the end of the week we were used to it! South Beach is a fabulous place to people watch and with the beach just literally across the road, we even managed to see a dolphin come up to the shoreline on our first day on the beach! Most of the staff are very pleasant at the hotel and the complimentary continental breakfast next door was just great! We loved South Beach, Miami and Park Central! Would definitely stay here again!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staff on the sidewalk to check bags upon arrival. Upgraded to ocean view. Beach towels and beach chairs included. Rooftop terrace is a great place to have a drink. Movie was shown one night.
reviews.title: Loved it! Great Staff & Location

likes.disliked: — Location of ice machine in other building

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The room was clean and neat. New carpets were being installed and painting was ongoing durng our stay. Someone was also cleaning during our stay. Quinn's restaurant is fabulous. Casablanca is also good. The hotel is in a great location. The News Cafe is at 800 Ocean. Many stores are between 600 and 800 Collins, Gap, Banana Rep., MAC, Ralph Lauren, Armani, etc.
reviews.title: cute hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The pool is the size of a residential pool at a private home. We expected that and it was great.
reviews.title: ROMANCE FOR TWO
Reception Unhelpful
reviews.text: Tours are available from the hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007
reviews.text: There is a CVS two blocks away for sodas, wine, beer, snacks, etc. (Corner of Washington)
reviews.title: Great Girls Weekend

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The best thing about this hotel is that it is in a great location if you want to be on Ocean Drive. It is right across the street from the beach. I feel like they really tried with this hotel - you can see a lot of personal touches like robes in the bathroom, newer TVs, and they are renovating rooms. The room was small but clean. The room had a lot of really nice, thoughtful details. Someone is really trying to make this hotel seem upscale. There is a tiny shop downstairs, which is convenient.
reviews.title: Would not go back

likes.disliked: — air conditioner was on it's way out

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: However, the air conditioner in our room consistently emitted a small engine roar after running quietly for five minutes and was so incredibly loud that we couldn't run it at night (and I am not a light sleeper). Consequently, our room pretty much felt like a sauna. We finally figured out that the noise happened after turning the air conditioning off and then turning it on again. When we left the air conditioning on all day and came back (we wanted to cool the room down so we could turn it off while we were in the room because of the noise), the sound would dim down to a dull hum, which seemed wasteful, but that is what we ended up doing. However, even with the noise down, the air conditioner didn't really work that great.
reviews.title: Mixed feelings on Park Central

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Other things that weren't so great about this hotel: there is only one ice machine - it's on the fourth floor, which was under construction. The afternoon staff are not that friendly; they feel kind of scornful. The maids and the morning staff were pretty nice.
reviews.title: Not sure what to say

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had dinner downstairs at Casablanca. I don't know what breakfast and lunch are like, but I would not recommend dinner. The drinks and appetizers were really good, but the entrees were really, really bad. Just completely bad.
reviews.title: Perfect South Beach Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Most of the other things I would overlook, but I wouldn't go back to this hotel just based on the air conditioner not working. Miami in the summer is a miserable experience without a functioning air conditioner.
reviews.title: Brill Brill
